skill.name: Testing Skill
skill.description: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.summary: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access. Documents pytest commands without executing them.

content.value_statement: Create comprehensive test suites for your pytest projects. This skill generates unit tests, reviews existing tests, and provides coverage analysis to ensure code quality.
actual_capabilities: Generate test cases for Python functions and modules
Review existing tests for quality and completeness
Run specialized test types: unit, integration, e2e, security, performance
Apply testing patterns: AAA, fixtures, property-based testing
Run mutation testing to validate test effectiveness
limitations: Does not execute tests directly - provides guidance on commands to run
Requires pytest and uv to be installed in the project
Coverage target is configurable but defaults to configured value
Test generation requires existing code to analyze

use_cases.title: Quick Test Generation
use_cases.description: Generate unit tests for newly written functions with proper fixtures and assertions

use_cases.title: Comprehensive Test Suites
use_cases.description: Build integration and end-to-end test suites for full system validation

use_cases.title: Coverage Enforcement
use_cases.description: Run coverage analysis and enforce minimum thresholds in CI/CD pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Basic Test Request
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need tests for a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for [function_name] in [module_path]. Use the AAA pattern with pytest fixtures as needed.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run coverage report and identify which lines in [module_name] are not covered. Suggest additional tests.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Create integration tests for [component] that verify correct interaction with [dependency].

prompt_templates.title: Security Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Write security-focused tests for [module] that validate input sanitization, authentication, and authorization.

output_examples.input: Write unit tests for the calculate_total function in src/utils/math.py
output: All tests use pytest fixtures and follow AAA pattern

best_practices: Use the AAA pattern (Arrange-Act-Assert) for clear, readable test structure
Create reusable pytest fixtures for common test data and setup
Maintain at least the configured coverage target for all code changes
anti_patterns: Avoid testing multiple assertions in a single test - split into separate tests
Do not couple tests to implementation details that change frequently
Avoid hardcoded values in tests - use fixtures and factories instead

faq.question: What testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on pytest, the most popular Python testing framework. It can also guide on unittest and hypothesis.

faq.question: What is the minimum coverage requirement?
faq.answer: Coverage target is configured in the project settings (default from template). Run pytest with --cov to check current coverage.

faq.question: How do I run specific test categories?
faq.answer: Use pytest markers: -m unit for unit tests, -m integration for integration tests. Define custom markers in pytest.ini.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates test code and documentation. It does not access or store any production data.

faq.question: Why are my tests not covering all branches?
faq.answer: Branch coverage requires tests for all conditional paths. Use --cov-branch flag and review the coverage report for specific uncovered branches.

faq.question: How does this compare to other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted test generation that understands your codebase. It complements tools like mutmut for mutation testing.
